intro: Scorzonera troodea, commonly known as the Troodos scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and yellowish to brownish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in mountainous areas. Scorzonera troodea has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in late summer. It is a perennial species that is relatively rare and of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution.
